reviewText: Okey, so it's short in comparison to the anime. So you can't fit all the humorous angst & attempts at scoring into one little DVD, but you can at least have a piece of it to get hooked onto. There's been rumor of Fake OAV2 if it hasn't already happened. I got this last year as an $8 VHS fansub. I didn't care for the dubb when it came out, but at least one of the voices was less annoying in English^_~

reviewText: This is an Anime take off from Volume 2 of the famous Fake series. Who couldn't love Dee?! I had to buy it to add to my Yaoi Collection. Even though it's only Shonen Ai, the most that goes on is a kiss and a Dee's sudden want to strip Ryo down and boink him, though it doesn't happen thanks to Bikky and Carol's interference. It is a wonderful OVA Movie, though there are no extras and all, it is still worth buying.

reviewText: This DVD is really good. It starts out with Dee and Ryo going on vacation. Away from all the crazy police life. They encounter a dead girl in the river that they are sailing in. There they meet the hotel owner. He seeks revenge for the murder of his daughter from japanese men. All the time this is happening Dee is trying to subdue Ryo into sleeping with him or at least getting Ryo to tell his feelings towards him.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Dude, I watched the anime and cringed. It looked like Ryo was being harassed by Dee. It was really sad because it looked like Ryo wasn't interested at all. In the manga, it's very different. It's clear from early on that Ryo *is* interested in Dee, even though Ryo is unwilling to admit to it ... much. I mean, the manga is absolutely spectacular, chock-full of plot and fun, realistic characterizations. The anime is just ... well, mediocre at best. Seriously, if you want strong, capable cops who are handsome and male and ... have a thing for each other, then go read the manga! Go!!

Title: N/A

reviewText: I didn't think I'd end up saying this but Fake has got to be one of the best animes I've ever seen and I've seen a lot. It has everything! Romance, action, comedy, suspense, and some of the most lovable characters I've come across in a long time. This movie has two story lines. One follows Dee and Ryo's relationship. You'll really find yourself caring about these two guys and actually rooting for Dee to go all the way with him. But unfortunately it never happens because the second story line interferes with it. I really thought the movie would be ruined with this second story line but it was actually very good. A hotel worker's daughter is killed by Japanese men so he takes his anger out on all Japanese people by killing them. This kind of thing happens in real life with racial stereotyping. So Dee and Ryo have to put their romance on hold and investigate the murders. If there is any justice in the world there will be a Fake 2 and it will focus more on Dee and Ryo's love for each other. There could be action but not so much next time. I never wanted the movie to end. I could watch these guys all day.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is truly sweet shonan-ai anime. In New York City, Dee Laytner is a tough cop that does not have a problem expressing his feelings. His partner, Randy (Ryo) MacClean, is an introverted guy who is confused about Dee's feelings towards him, as well as his own feelings towards Dee. When these two decide to go on vacation together in the English countryside, Dee thinks its a great time to put the movies on his pouty partner. But their weekend is interupted by a serial killer out to get anyone who is Japanese.
summary: A warm hearted shonan-ai anime that did not quite live up the manga

reviewText: What is up with most anime that leaves you hanging. It was pretty good but I wish it was a series. But I think it was but they didn't want to publish anymore. It was funny and romanic in a weird way. But it leaves you hanging and wondering what happen next or what happen before. I don't like anime that gives just alittle informnation. It was ok. But it could of been better.
summary: It was pretty good but again a anime that leaves you Hanging

reviewText: I didn't expect this movie to be as good as the book, and sadly I was right. It was difficult for me to enjoy the movie due to all the repeated yelling and over reacting going on. The animation itself stays very true to the books surpirsingly, which was nice. The story also stays very true to the books. If I were to recommend some Yaoi that I thought was a better movie, I'd have to recommend Kizuna... much, much better.
summary: Not As Good As The Books
Title: N/A

reviewText: This OAV (original Animated Video) is based off of a shounen ai (boy's love) manga (comic book) series by Sanami Matoh.  This is the story of two cops Dee Laytner and his partner a bi-racial (caucasian and japanese) man named Randy McClaine.  The two are cops from the NYPD 27th precinct who decide to spend their vaction together at a hotel in England.  Things for the couple begin to go sour when Randy discovers the body of a slain Japanese woman as a result they find out that several Japanese tourist have turned up missing-dead in the area.  Dee doesn't want to get involved but Randy one the other hand is interested.  More things go wrong when the handsome, mysterious Barkley Rose shows up on the scene; Vick and Carol also intrude; a ghost makes an appearance; a young, bratty cop named J.J. also shows up.This is a very funny, well-written, nicely dubbed OAV that anyone can appreciate and enjoy. I highly recommend it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Perhaps the strangest "cartoon" I have ever seen.  I find Japanese films pretty odd at the best of times but this is quite simply one that has to be seen to be believed.  However that is a recommendation.The two main characters actually work quite well and apart from the face explosions (the catoonist can't seem to draw feelings very well) it's not that bad!This is certainly not for main stream viewing but at the same time is not offensive.  It's apparently known as "Yaoi" so look it up before you buy or check the other reviews.Summary: Unique.
